legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: Business Register and Employment Survey 2024

title.text: You are completing this for {ru_name} {trad_as}

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: You have been selected to complete the Business Register and Employment Survey (BRES).
Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland and Wales unless otherwise stated.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.
You cannot appeal your selection. Your organisation was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
You still need to complete this survey even if it does not seem relevant. All returns are important as it helps us produce better statistics.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
You can save or print a copy of your answers for your records at the end of this survey.

contents.description: View more information about this survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
In this section you will be asked to check and provide information on the structure of your organisation.
This includes:

list: the name and address of your organisation
the operational status of your organisation
VAT details
employer's PAYE references
additional references not already captured
number of sites in Great Britain
number of employees

contents.description: In this section you will be presented with your organisation's existing sites. You will be asked to check the information for any errors and provide details of any changes.
This includes:

list: the name, address and postcode of the site
the operational status of the site
number of full-time and part-time employees of the site
the organisation activity of the site

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide details of any additional sites.
This includes:

list: organisation name and trading style
address and postcode of the additional site
when the additional site started trading
the main organisation activity of the site
number of full-time and part-time employees

The information you supply is the only information used by the Office for National Statistics (ONS) to update its Inter Departmental Business Register (IDBR) at workplace level with location, employment and Standard Industrial Classification details.
ONS uses the IDBR to design statistical surveys required to produce UK National Accounts.

Your information contributes to local and national employment statistics (this link opens in a new tab), which are used in policy making, strategic planning and monitoring of employment trends by government departments and local authorities.
The information also feeds into a number of key measures of the UK economy.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab).

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to check and provide information on the structure of your organisation.
This includes:

list: the name and address of your organisation
the operational status of your organisation
VAT details
employer's PAYE references
additional references not already captured
number of sites in Great Britain
number of employees

title.text: We currently hold your organisation name as {ru_name} {trad_as}. Is this correct?

description:
If you have a trading style or a name the organisation trades under registered with us, this will appear in brackets after your organisation name.

The organisation name specified may not be your organisation's legal name if you have previously agreed a reporting structure with ONS.

options.label: Yes, the organisation name is correct
options.value: Yes, the organisation name is correct

options.label: No, the organisation name is not correct
options.value: No, the organisation name is not correct

in: Yes, the organisation name is correct

question.title: What is the correct name of your organisation?

description.text:
Organisation name we currently hold:

{ru_name}

If you have a trading style or a name the organisation trades under, include this in brackets after your organisation name.

title.text: We currently hold this organisation's address as {address}. Is this correct?

options.label: Yes, the organisation address is correct
options.value: Yes, the organisation address is correct

options.label: No, the organisation address is not correct
options.value: No, the organisation address is not correct

in: Yes, the organisation address is correct

question.title: What is the correct address for your organisation?

contents.description: Include the property number, where applicable.

blocks.page_title: Changes to address for your organisation

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, which category best described the operational status of your organisation?

description: If your organisation is seasonal, treat as if it is active.

options.label: The organisation was active with all or part of the activity taking place within Great Britain (GB)
options.value: The organisation was active with all or part of the activity taking place within Great Britain (GB)
options.description: Great Britain consists of England, Scotland and Wales

options.label: The organisation was active with all of the activity taking place outside GB
options.value: The organisation was active with all of the activity taking place outside GB

options.label: The organisation was now part of another GB organisation due to a takeover or merger
options.value: The organisation was now part of another GB organisation due to a takeover or merger

options.label: The organisation had not started operating yet
options.value: The organisation had not started operating yet

options.label: The organisation had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years
options.value: The organisation had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years

options.label: The organisation had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years
options.value: The organisation had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years

options.label: The organisation had never started operating and is not expecting to start
options.value: The organisation had never started operating and is not expecting to start

in: The organisation was active with all or part of the activity taking place within Great Britain (GB)

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, was the following VAT registration number and subsidiary reference number correct for your organisation?

description.text:
If your organisation was part of a VAT group, any number given will include a three digit subsidiary reference number as part of the overall VAT number.

One or both of these may appear blank.

VAT registration number: {vat_registrationnumber}

Subsidiary reference number: {vat_subsidiaryidentifier}

options.label: Yes, these numbers are correct
options.value: Yes, these numbers are correct

options.label: No, these numbers are not correct
options.value: No, these numbers are not correct

options.label: The organisation was exempt from VAT
options.value: The organisation was exempt from VAT

blocks.page_title: Correct VAT registration number and subsidiary reference number of your organisation

in: No, these numbers are not correct

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, what was the correct VAT registration number and subsidiary reference number for your organisation?

answers.label: VAT registration number
answers.description: This is 9 numbers, sometimes with 'GB' at the start and can be found on your VAT registration certificate. Only enter the 9 numbers

answers.label: Subsidiary reference number
answers.description: If your business is part of a VAT group, this is the additional 3 numbers after the VAT registration number. Leave blank if your business is not part of a VAT group

blocks.page_title: Changes to VAT registration number and subsidiary reference number for your organisation

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, was the following tax office number and employer's PAYE reference number correct for your organisation?

description.text:
This consists of a tax office number followed by an employer's PAYE reference number, which can be found on your paying-in book and form P35.

One or both of these may appear blank.

Tax office number: {employerpaye_taxofficenumber}

Employer's PAYE reference number: {employerpaye_reference}

options.label: Yes, these numbers are correct
options.value: Yes, these numbers are correct

options.label: No, these numbers are not correct
options.value: No, these numbers are not correct

blocks.page_title: Correct tax office number and employer's PAYE reference number for your organisation

in: No, these numbers are not correct

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, what was the correct tax office number and employer's PAYE reference number for your organisation?

description: This consists of a tax office number followed by an employer's PAYE reference number, which can be found on your paying-in book and form P35.

blocks.page_title: Changes to tax office number and PAYE reference number for your organisation

question.title: Provide any additional VAT or employer PAYE reference numbers that your organisation currently has

answers.label: Additional VAT or employer PAYE reference numbers

blocks.page_title: Additional VAT or employer PAYE reference numbers for your organisation

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, how many sites in Great Britain did your organisation operate from?

description:
Provide figures for organisation activity within Great Britain only. Exclude Northern Ireland.

Great Britain consists of England, Scotland and Wales.

contents.description: This refers to sites where one or more persons carried out economic activity for a minimum of 20 hours per week and the planned activity for your organisation was for more than one year.
Examples of sites include:

list: workshops
factories
warehouses
offices
mines
depots
construction sites

blocks.page_title: Total number of sites in Great Britain your organisation operated from

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, what was your organisation's total number of employees?

description: This figure should be total head count working on the specified date rather than job roles to avoid double counting employees.

contents.description: Include:

list: full-time, over 30 hours a week, and part-time, 30 hours or less, employees aged 16 years and over. This includes individuals working from home and those temporarily absent but still employed, for example those on parental leave or sick leave
employees at sites where the planned activity was for less than one year
employees at sites staffed for less than 20 hours per week
North Sea oil workers and any other employees working on the UK Continental Shelf (UKCS). The UKCS is the region of waters surrounding the United Kingdom in which the country claims mineral rights
NHS bank staff

contents.description: Exclude:

list: directors and working owners not paid via PAYE
agency workers paid directly from the agency payroll
voluntary employees
former employees only receiving a pension

contents.description: An employee is anyone aged 16 years or over who was working directly for the organisation. They may have been paid direct from the organisation, from elsewhere within the wider group, or by an external payroll provider on behalf of the company. If your organisation uses a central payroll to pay employees who work within the wider group, only include employees who worked directly for the organisation.

question.title: Provide any additional comments regarding changes to your organisation's operational status
description:
If your organisation has been taken over or merged with another UK organisation, provide us with the contact details of the organisation that should now complete this survey.

It is important that you supply supporting information regarding any organisation status or structure changes.

in: The organisation was active with all or part of the activity taking place within Great Britain (GB)

question.title: Provide any additional comments regarding changes to your organisation's operational status, not included in the previous questions
description: If your organisation has been taken over or merged with another UK organisation, provide us with the contact details of the organisation that should now complete this survey.

in: The organisation was active with all of the activity taking place outside GB
The organisation was now part of another GB organisation due to a takeover or merger
The organisation had not started operating yet
The organisation had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years
The organisation had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years
The organisation had never started operating and is not expecting to start

title.text: {localunits_name}, {localunits_address}

contents.description: In this section you will be presented with your organisation's existing sites. You will be asked to check the information for any errors and provide details of any changes.
If you do not have any existing sites, you will be asked to repeat some of the information you have provided in previous questions.
This includes:

list: the name, address and postcode of the site
the operational status of the site
number of full-time and part-time employees of the site
the organisation activity of the site

title.text: We currently hold this site's name as {localunits_name} ({localunits_tradingname}). Is this correct?

description: If you have a trading style or a name the site trades under registered with us, this will appear in brackets after your site name. Otherwise it may appear blank.

options.label: Yes, the name of this site is correct
options.value: Yes, the name of this site is correct

options.label: No, the name of this site is not correct
options.value: No, the name of this site is not correct

in: Yes, the name of this site is correct

question.title: What is the correct name of this site?

description.text:
Site name we currently hold:

{localunits_name}

If you have a trading style or a name the site trades under, include this in brackets after your site name.

blocks.page_title: Changes to name for this site

title.text: We currently hold the address as {localunits_address}. Is this correct?

options.label: Yes, the address of this site is correct
options.value: Yes, the address of this site is correct

options.label: No, the address of this site is not correct
options.value: No, the address of this site is not correct

in: Yes, the address of this site is correct

question.title: What is the correct address for this site?

contents.description: Include the property number, where applicable.

blocks.page_title: Changes to address for this site

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, was this site staffed for a minimum of 20 hours per week or had planned activity for more than a year?

contents.description:
If you answer no to this question, include any employees associated with this site in the figures you have reported for your main or head site.

You will be able to amend your figures in the business structure section once you have answered this question.

options.label: Yes
options.value: Yes

options.label: No
options.value: No

in: Yes

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, which category best described the operational status of this site?

options.label: The site was active and operated by this organisation
options.value: The site was active and operated by this organisation

options.label: The site had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years
options.value: The site had ceased operating but is expecting to restart within two years

options.label: The site had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years
options.value: The site had ceased operating and is not expecting to restart within two years

options.label: The site had been transferred to another organisation
options.value: The site had been transferred to another organisation

in: The site was active and operated by this organisation

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, what was the number of full-time and part-time employees that your business paid from its payroll, for this site?

contents.description: Include:

list: full-time, over 30 hours a week, and part-time, 30 hours or less, employees aged 16 years and over. This includes individuals working from home and those temporarily absent but still employed, for example those on parental leave or sick leave
North Sea oil workers and any other employees working on the UK Continental Shelf (UKCS). The UKCS is the region of waters surrounding the United Kingdom in which the country claims mineral rights
NHS bank staff
home or field workers whose work was organised from this site

contents.description: Exclude:

list: directors and working owners not paid via PAYE
agency workers paid directly from the agency payroll
voluntary employees
former employees only receiving a pension

contents.description: An employee is anyone aged 16 years or over who was working directly for the organisation. They may have been paid direct from the organisation, from elsewhere within the wider group, or by an external payroll provider on behalf of the company. If your organisation uses a central payroll to pay employees who work within the wider group, only include employees who worked directly for the organisation.

answers.label: Number of full-time employees
answers.description: This refers to employees working more than 30 hours per week

answers.label: Number of part-time employees
answers.description: This refers to employees working 30 hours or fewer per week

blocks.page_title: Number of employees working at this site
Calculated total number of employees for this site

title.text: On {ref_p_start_date}, we have calculated the total number of employees that your organisation paid from its payroll, for this site, to be %(total)s. Is this correct?
